channel.title: Mediagazer
channel.description: Top news and commentary for media professionals from all around the web

item.title: 毎月4時間のエピソードで成功企業のケーススタディを提供するポッドキャスト「アクワイアード」が、C-suiteや副社長クラスのエグゼクティブの間で人気となった理由（Ben Cohen/Wall Street Journal）
item.description:
Ben Cohen / Wall Street Journal:
How Acquired, a podcast that offers case studies of successful companies in monthly four-hour episodes, became a favorite among C-suite and VP-level executives  —  How did Acquired become the business world's favorite show?  —  It's a wonky podcast about business history and strategy with four-hour episodes that drop once a month.

item.title: Foxによると、Tubiの第3四半期のMAUは前年同期の6,700万から8,000万に増加、売上は前年同期比22％増、総視聴時間は前年同期比36％増、うち90％がオンデマンドによるもの（David Satin/The Streamable）。
item.description:
David Satin / The Streamable:
Fox says Tubi had ~80M MAUs in Q3, up from 67M a year ago, 22% YoY revenue growth, and a 36% YoY increase in total view time, 90% of which comes from on-demand  —  Tubi finished Fox's fiscal third quarter just behind Disney+ in terms of total TV viewing time, and may continue to climb.

item.title: 電子メール：犯人はWPPのマーク・リードCEOをターゲットに、音声クローンとYouTubeの公開映像を使って幹部とのビデオ会議をセットアップするディープフェイク詐欺を仕掛ける（Daniel Thomas/Financial Times）
item.description:
Daniel Thomas / Financial Times:
Email: criminals target WPP CEO Mark Read in a deepfake scam by using a voice clone and public YouTube footage to set up a video meeting with his executives  —  Mark Read says criminals set up Microsoft Teams call with senior executives in unsuccessful attack

item.title: 検閲をかわすためにYouTubeを利用したインドのジャーナリストたちによると、YouTubeは政府の通達を理由に、自分たちのニュースチャンネルを禁止したり、廃止したりしている（Raksha Kumar/Reuters Institute）。
item.description:
Raksha Kumar / Reuters Institute:
Some Indian journalists who turned to YouTube to dodge censorship say the company is banning or demonetizing their news channels, citing government notices  —  As the country votes in this year's crucial election, news channels are being banned or demonetised in a move criticised by press freedom groups

item.title: トークラジオ局WABCがルディ・ジュリアーニを停職処分にし、毎日の番組をキャンセル。
item.description:
Nicholas Fandos / New York Times:
Talk radio station WABC suspends Rudy Giuliani and cancels his daily show, saying he broke rules by trying to discuss discredited claims about 2020's election  —  The station's owner, John Catsimatidis, a Republican billionaire, said he suspended the former mayor for persisting in talking …

item.title: 5月11日のユーロビジョン・ファイナルを前に、イスラエル・ガザ紛争をめぐる緊張が、政治的中立性を維持しようとする主催者の努力を複雑にしている（Louis Staples/Rolling Stone）。
item.description:
Louis Staples / Rolling Stone:
Ahead of the Eurovision finals on May 11, tensions over the Israel-Gaza war complicate the organizers' efforts to maintain an appearance of political neutrality  —  At the glittery, eccentric spectacle, controversy and protests about Israel's inclusion overshadow the music.  Can the contest ever be apolitical?

item.title: NYTと非営利団体City BureauとInvisible Instituteは、ピューリッツァー賞を受賞した調査に役立つカスタム機械学習ツールをどのようにトレーニングしたか（Andrew Deck/Nieman Lab）
item.description:
Andrew Deck / Nieman Lab:
How the NYT and nonprofits City Bureau and Invisible Institute trained custom machine learning tools to help with their Pulitzer Prize-winning investigations  —  Awarded investigative stories are increasingly relying on machine learning, whether covering Chicago police negligence or Israeli weapons in Gaza

item.title: 経済ニュースの論調が現実から遠ざかるにつれ、米国の経済・ガス価格に関する報道、特にケーブルニュースには否定的なバイアスがかかっているという研究結果（John Burn-Murdoch/Financial Times）
item.description:
John Burn-Murdoch / Financial Times:
Studies show a negativity bias in US coverage of the economy and gas prices, particularly cable news, as the tone of economic news moves away from reality  —  A new study adds to the evidence that competition for eyeballs may be warping our sense of the world

item.title: ノースカロライナ州の権力と場所に関する」3年前のデジタル雑誌「The Assembly」が、地元慈善団体の資金援助を受けてグリーンズボロ支局を計画中と発表（The Assembly NC）
item.description:
The Assembly NC:
The Assembly, a three-year-old digital magazine “on power and place in North Carolina”, announces it plans a Greensboro bureau, with local philanthropic funding  —  The Assembly, a three-year-old digital magazine on power and place in North Carolina, is announcing the launch …

item.title: カトリック系ラジオ局3社、ラジオ・テレビ局にスタッフの人種と性別に関する情報公開を義務付ける要件をめぐり、FCCに異議申し立て（Jonah McKeown/Catholic News Agency）
item.description:
Jonah McKeown / Catholic News Agency:
Three Catholic radio stations file a petition against the FCC over requirements mandating that radio and TV stations publish info about staff race and gender  —  A trio of Catholic radio networks has filed a petition against the U.S. Federal Communications Commission (FCC) …

item.title: 情報筋Netflixが12月25日にNFLの2試合をストリーミング配信する契約に近づいている（John Ourand/Puck）
item.description:
John Ourand / Puck:
Sources: Netflix is nearing a deal to stream two NFL games on December 25  —  It looks like Netflix will wind up carrying the two NFL games scheduled for December 25, per a bevy of sources.  It's a first-of-its-kind deal, and almost certainly not the last.

item.title: 映画芸術科学アカデミーが5億ドルのキャンペーンを発表 アカデミー賞の視聴率低下に伴い、世界的な影響力の拡大と収益の多様化を目指す（Josh Rottenberg/Los Angeles Times）
item.description:
Josh Rottenberg / Los Angeles Times:
The Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences announces a $500M campaign to extend its influence globally and diversify revenue as Oscars ratings drop  —  Looking to safeguard its future in a world in which the Oscars have lost some of their ratings luster, the Academy of Motion Picture Arts …

item.title: ラインアップ・パブリッシングが来週、デッドスピンを再始動させる予定だと発表。
item.description:
A.J. Perez / Front Office Sports:
Lineup Publishing says it plans to relaunch Deadspin next week; it appears the new Deadspin will focus on sports betting  —  Deadspin's latest revival is slated to take place next week, although its new Malta-based owners have given no indication about the editorial direction for the sports site.

item.title: メモスポティファイのポッドキャスト・スタジオ責任者ジュリー・マクナマラが約3年で退社、ポッドキャストにおけるスポティファイの野心縮小を強調（Ashley Carman/Bloomberg）
item.description:
Ashley Carman / Bloomberg:
Memo: Spotify's head of podcast studios, Julie McNamara, is leaving the company after nearly three years, emphasizing Spotify's reduced ambitions in podcasts  —  - Executive internally announced her departure on Thursday  — Exit follows layoffs, show cancellations and reorganizations

item.title: C-SPANのビジネス上の選択により、YouTube TVのようなストリーミングTVプラットフォームでは提供されず、ケーブルや衛星からの資金調達に依存している（Matthew Keys/The Desk）
item.description:
Matthew Keys / The Desk:
C-SPAN's own business choices keep the network from being offered on streaming TV platforms like YouTube TV, as it stays reliant on cable and satellite funding  —  Forty years ago, you might be hard-pressed to find anyone in the country who regularly watched the political affairs network called C-SPAN …
